ALLEN MILLER
602 GLADSTONE STREET
PULLMAN, WASHINGTON 99163
October 7, 1968
Mr. Robert A. Mott, Director
National Educational Radio
134-6 Connecticut Ave., N.W.
Washington, D.C., 20036
Dear Bob:
Your idea of sending proof for the 1969 NAEB cflFectory
of educational broadcasting is an excellent one from
my point of view. The timing of the directory is
quite fortuitous.
NER could be of very material added assistance. I
believe that a letter from you telling your members
of the importance to CPB of the information sought in
the questionnaire and of their responding promptly
would be effective in both increasing the number of
responses and in getting them back in time for quick
tabulation before the CPB Board meeting on November
20 th.
I hope you will circularize your members promptly.
The questionnaires will be ready by Wednesday. The
letter of transmittal is ready also, waiting only
for a count of the number required before duplication.
As soon as these are run, I will see that you have
copies of each.
Cordially yours.
am ; m
cc:' Saul Haas
P.S. I am wondering whether some of the stations in¬
cluded in the directory are non-commercial in opera¬
tion. Specifically, I raise questions regarding
WRUF-FM, Gainesville, Fla., WHCU and WHCU-FM, Ithaca,
N.Y., and WHAZ in Troy, N.Y.
